meanings.definition: Having a sympathetic or kind nature.
meanings.sent1: She is so softhearted that she always helps others in need.
meanings.sent2: The softhearted nurse comforted the scared child with a gentle smile.
meanings.sent3: The softhearted teacher couldn't resist adopting all the classroom pets.
meanings.sent4: His softhearted nature was like a warm blanket on a cold day, comforting everyone around him.
meanings.sent5: The image of the softhearted old man feeding stray cats will forever stay in my mind.

meanings.definition: Easily moved to pity or compassion.
meanings.sent1: The softhearted girl couldn't bear to see anyone sad.
meanings.sent2: He was so softhearted that even sad movies made him cry.
meanings.sent3: The softhearted puppy looked up at him with big, pleading eyes.
meanings.sent4: Her softhearted response to the plea touched everyone in the room.
meanings.sent5: The softhearted gesture of offering his coat to the shivering stranger was truly heartwarming.
